alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 12:45AM CST until February 19 at 8:40PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Sugar Creek at Milford affecting Iroquois County. For the Sugar Creek...including Milford...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sugar Creek at Milford. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 21.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon to 13.2 feet and begin rising again early Monday morning. It will rise to 16.6 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation and snow melt as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 645 PM CST this evening.
